name: Abyssal Nightstalker

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

text: Whenever Abyssal Nightstalker attacks and isn't blocked, defending player discards a card.
originalText: If Abyssal Nightstalker attacks and isn't blocked, your opponent chooses and discards a card from his or her hand. (Ignore this effect if your opponent doesn't have any cards.)

text: Flying
flavor: As insubstantial, and as powerful, as the wind that carries it.
originalText: Flying
name: Air Elemental

text: Whenever Alaborn Cavalier attacks, you may tap target creature.
flavor:
"Course he ran! I wouldn't want to stare down that barrel, either!"
—Alaborn soldier
originalText: If Alaborn Cavalier attacks, you may choose to tap any one creature. (Tapped creatures can't block.)
name: Alaborn Cavalier
Alaborn Grenadier
text: Vigilance
originalText: Attacking doesn't cause Alaborn Grenadier to tap.
flavor:
"Ever proud, ever vigilant."
—Grenadier motto

name: Alaborn Musketeer
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
originalText: Alaborn Musketeer can block creatures with flying.
flavor: Muskets gave the Alaborn army an advantage it had long lacked—air defense.

name: Alaborn Trooper
flavor:
"I dedicate my body to my country
And my life to my King."
—Alaborn Soldier's Oath

name: Alaborn Veteran

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

text: {T}: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Alaborn Veteran to give any one creature +2/+2 until the end of the turn.

name: Alaborn Zealot
text: When Alaborn Zealot blocks a creature, destroy that creature and Alaborn Zealot.
originalText: If Alaborn Zealot blocks, destroy both Alaborn Zealot and the creature it blocks. (Destroy both creatures before you deal damage.)

name: Alluring Scent
text: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
originalText: Choose any one creature. This turn, all creatures able to block it do so.
flavor: No earthly armor is protection against this sweetness.

name: Ancient Craving
text: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.
originalText: Draw 3 cards. You lose 3 life.
flavor:
"Knowledge demands sacrifice."
—Tojira, swamp queen

name: Angel of Fury

rulings.text: If Angel of Fury is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, it won't get shuffled into its owner's library. Similarly, if a replacement effect has the Incarnation move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won't trigger at all.

Angel of Fury's second ability is a leaves-the-battlefield ability. Because it works only from on the battlefield, it behaves differently than the _Lorwyn_ Incarnations. When Angel of Fury is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, it will look back in time (to the point just before it left the battlefield) to see if its ability triggers. That means the following: -- If Angel of Fury lost its triggered ability while on the battlefield (due to Snakeform, for example) and then was destroyed, the ability would not trigger. Angel of Fury would stay in its owner's graveyard. -- If Angel of Fury had its triggered ability when it left the battlefield, but lost it when it was put into the graveyard (due to Yixlid Jailer, for example), the ability would still trigger. Angel of Fury would be shuffled into its owner's library.

text:
Flying
When Angel of Fury dies, you may shuffle it into its owner's library.
originalText:
Flying
If Angel of Fury is put into your graveyard from play, you may choose to shuffle Angel of Fury into your library.

name: Angel of Mercy
text:
Flying
When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
originalText:
Flying
When Angel of Mercy comes into play from your hand, you gain 3 life.

name: Angelic Blessing
text: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
originalText: Any one creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until the end of the turn.
flavor: The man who rose up to fight was not the same man knocked down.

text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
flavor: Be at peace, and observe its beauty. Be at war, and feel its justice.
originalText:
Flying 
Walls can't attack.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Apprentice Sorcerer to have it deal 1 damage to any one creature or player.

name: Archangel
text: Flying, vigilance
originalText:
Flying
Attacking doesn't cause Archangel to tap.

text: Destroy all lands.

text: Armored Galleon can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
originalText: Armored Galleon can't attack unless the defending player has an island in play.

"Information equals profits. Our merchants sell it, or our pirates use it."
—Jefan, Talas ship captain

name: Armored Griffin
text: Flying, vigilance
originalText:
Flying
Attacking doesn't cause Armored Griffin to tap.

name: Barbtooth Wurm
flavor: In its lair lies a carpet of bones.

name: Bargain
text:
Target opponent draws a card.
You gain 7 life.
originalText:
Your opponent draws a card.
You gain 7 life.
flavor: Bargaining with a goblin is like trading with a child; both believe they already own everything.

name: Bear Cub
flavor:
Every little cub has its mother's teeth to guard it.
—Elvish saying

name: Bee Sting
text: Bee Sting deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
originalText: Bee Sting deals 2 damage to any one creature or player.
flavor:
Busy as a bumblebee, blistered as a goblin.
—Alaborn saying

name: Blaze
text: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.
originalText: Blaze deals X damage to any one creature or player.
flavor:
"This isn't what I meant by ‘facing the heat of battle!'"
—Jefan, Talas ship captain

name: Bloodcurdling Scream
text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
originalText: Any one creature gets +X/+0 until the end of the turn.
flavor:
"I have all the weapons my enemies have—and far deeper rage."
—Tojira, swamp queen

name: Breath of Life
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
originalText: Take any one creature card from your graveyard and put that creature into play. Treat it as though you just played it from your hand.

name: Brimstone Dragon
text: Flying, haste
originalText:
Flying
Brimstone Dragon is unaffected by summoning sickness.

name: Brutal Nightstalker
text: When Brutal Nightstalker enters the battlefield, you may have target opponent discard a card.
originalText: When Brutal Nightstalker comes into play from your hand, you may force your opponent to choose and discard a card from his or her hand.

name: Chorus of Woe
text: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
originalText: All your creatures get +1/+0 until the end of the turn.
flavor: When nightstalkers sing, nothing in creation sleeps.

name: Coastal Wizard

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

text: {T}: Return Coastal Wizard and another target creature to their owners' hands. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Coastal Wizard to return it and any one other creature to their owners' hands.

name: Coercion
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
originalText: Look at your opponent's hand and choose a card. Your opponent discards that card.

"Human tenderness is simply weakness in a pretty package."
—Tojira, swamp queen

name: Cruel Edict
text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature.
originalText: Your opponent chooses one of his or her creatures. Destroy that creature.
flavor:
"Such a fragile organ, the brain."
—Tojira, swamp queen

name: Cunning Giant
text: If Cunning Giant is unblocked, you may have it assign its combat damage to a creature defending player controls.
originalText: If Cunning Giant attacks and isn't blocked, you may choose to have it deal its damage to any one of your opponent's creatures instead of to him or her.

name: Dakmor Bat
text: Flying
originalText: Flying
flavor: The bat thrives on what underestimates it.

name: Dakmor Plague
text: Dakmor Plague deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
originalText: Dakmor Plague deals 3 damage to each creature and player. (This includes your creatures and you.)
flavor: The tiniest cough can be deadlier than the fiercest dragon.

name: Dakmor Scorpion
flavor: A scorpion this big you won't find curled up in your boot. Maybe around your boot, but not in it.

name: Dakmor Sorceress
text: Dakmor Sorceress's power is equal to the number of Swamps you control.
originalText: Dakmor Sorceress has power equal to the number of swamp cards you have in play. (This includes both tapped and untapped swamp cards.)

name: Dark Offering
text: Destroy target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.
originalText: Destroy any one creature that isn't black. You gain 3 life.
flavor:
"Our greatest hope has become our enemy's greatest triumph."
—Restela, Alaborn marshal

name: Deathcoil Wurm

rulings.text: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

text: You may have Deathcoil Wurm assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
originalText: If Deathcoil Wurm attacks and is blocked, you may choose to have it deal its damage to the defending player instead of to the creatures blocking it.

name: Deep Wood
text:
Cast Deep Wood only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by attacking creatures.
originalText:
Play Deep Wood only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.
This turn, all damage dealt to you by attacking creatures is reduced to 0.

name: Déjà Vu
text: Return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
originalText: Return any one sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: History is the study of repetition.

name: Denizen of the Deep
text: When Denizen of the Deep enters the battlefield, return each other creature you control to its owner's hand.
originalText: When Denizen of the Deep comes into play from your hand, return all your other creatures from play to your hand.

name: Earthquake

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature is without flying is only checked on resolution.

text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.
originalText: Earthquake deals X damage to each player and each creature without flying. (This includes you and your creatures without flying.)

name: Exhaustion

rulings.text: The creatures and lands are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player's next untap step. They can still can untap during other player's untap steps.
No creatures or lands controlled by the player will untap during his or her next untap step. This includes those which entered the battlefield after Exhaustion resolved.

text: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.
originalText: At the beginning of your opponent's next turn, he or she skips untapping creatures and lands.

name: Extinguish
text: Counter target sorcery spell.
originalText: Play Extinguish only in response to another player playing a sorcery. That sorcery has no effect, and that player puts it into his or her graveyard.

name: Eye Spy
text: Look at the top card of target player's library. You may put that card into his or her graveyard.
originalText: Look at the top card of any player's library. You may choose to put that card back on top of that library or into that player's graveyard.

name: False Summoning
text: Counter target creature spell.
originalText: Play False Summoning only in response to another player playing a creature. That creature card has no effect, and that player puts it into his or her graveyard.

name: Festival of Trokin
text: You gain 2 life for each creature you control.
originalText: For each creature you have in play, you gain 2 life.
flavor: Everyone loves a good sale.

text: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
originalText: When Goblin Matron comes into play from your hand, search your library for a Goblin card and put that card into your hand. Shuffle your library afterwards.
name: Goblin Matron

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type "Summon Goblin" and "Summon Goblins" also count. You can't search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don't have the creature type Goblin.

text: Mountainwalk
flavor: Goblin mountaineer, barely keeps his family fed.
originalText: Mountainwalk (If defending player has any mountains in play, Goblin Mountaineer can't be blocked.)
name: Goblin Mountaineer
Goblin Piker
flavor: Once he'd worked out which end of the thing was sharp, he was promoted to guard duty.

text: Goblin Raider can't block.

"I seen lots o' fights. To win ya gotta bash hard and not get bashed back."

originalText: Goblin Raider can't block.

Stones fly, soldiers die!"

If the creature is no longer on the battlefield when the ability resolves, you may still perform the action if you want.

rulings.text: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

name: Nature's Lore

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can find any card with the land type Forest, including Snow-covered Forest or non-Basic lands like Tropical Island, Murmuring Bosk, or Stomping Ground. You can even find a card that is a land in addition to other types, such as Dryad Arbor.

text: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
originalText: Search your library for a forest card and put that forest into play. Shuffle your library afterwards.
flavor:
"Every seed planted is another lesson the forest can teach us."
—Arathel, elvish queen

text: Nightstalker Engine's power is equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
originalText: Nightstalker Engine has power equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
originalText: Norwood Archers can block creatures with flying.

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

name: Raise Dead

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.
A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
originalText: Return any one creature from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor:
"Life from death is part of the natural cycle. This is merely a shortcut."
—Tojira, swamp queen

name: Rally the Troops
text:
Cast Rally the Troops only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Untap all creatures you control.
originalText:
Play Rally the Troops only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.
Untap all your creatures.

name: Ravenous Rats
text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
originalText: When Ravenous Rats comes into play from your hand, your opponent chooses and discards a card from his or her hand. (Ignore this effect if your opponent doesn't have any cards.)

name: Razorclaw Bear
text: Whenever Razorclaw Bear becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
originalText: If Razorclaw Bear attacks and is blocked, it gets +2/+2 until the end of the turn.
flavor:
One razorclaw is three bears too many.
—Elvish saying

name: Relentless Assault

rulings.text: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
originalText: Untap all your creatures that attacked this turn. You may declare an additional attack this turn.

name: Remove
text:
Cast Remove only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Return target attacking creature to its owner's hand.
originalText:
Play Remove only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.
Return any one attacking creature to its owner's hand.

name: Renewing Touch
text: Shuffle any number of target creature cards from your graveyard into your library.
originalText: Choose any number of creature cards in your graveyard and shuffle them into your library.
flavor: Death just encourages life the more.

name: Return of the Nightstalkers
text: Return all Nightstalker permanent cards from your graveyard to the battlefield. Then destroy all Swamps you control.
originalText: Return all the Nightstalker cards from your graveyard to play. Then destroy all your swamps. (Treat these Nightstalkers as though they just came into play from your hand.)

name: Righteous Charge

rulings.text: Only creatures you control when Righteous Charge resolves will get +2/+2. Creatures that come under your control later in the turn will not.

text: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
originalText: All your creatures get +2/+2 until the end of the turn.
flavor:
"Bravery shines brightest in a pure soul."
—Restela, Alaborn marshal

name: Righteous Fury
text: Destroy all tapped creatures. You gain 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.
originalText: Destroy all tapped creatures. For each creature destroyed this way, you gain 2 life. (This includes your creatures.)

text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor: The bears had been isolated on an island for hundreds of years, until the island sank and the bears didn't.
originalText: Islandwalk (If defending player has any islands in play, River Bear can't be blocked.)
name: River Bear
Salvage
text: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.
originalText: Take any one card from your graveyard and put that card on the top of your library.
flavor:
"What was taken shall be restored."
—Arathel, elvish queen

name: Screeching Drake
text:
Flying
When Screeching Drake enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.
originalText:
Flying
When Screeching Drake comes into play from your hand, draw a card, then choose and discard a card from your hand.

name: Sea Drake

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, if one of the lands has become an illegal target (because it's no longer on the battlefield, for example), you return the other one to your hand. If both of the lands have become illegal targets, the ability is countered. This has no effect on Sea Drake.

text:
Flying
When Sea Drake enters the battlefield, return two target lands you control to their owner's hand.
originalText:
Flying
When Sea Drake comes into play from your hand, return any two of your lands from play to your hand.

name: Sleight of Hand

rulings.text: If there is only one card in your library, it goes to your hand.

text: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.
originalText: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.

name: Spitting Earth
text: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
originalText: Spitting Earth deals to any one creature damage equal to the number of mountains you have in play. (This includes both tapped and untapped mountains.)

text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
flavor: "You idiots! Turn it around! Turn it around!"
originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Steam Catapult to destroy any one tapped creature.
name: Steam Catapult

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

name: Steam Frigate
text: Steam Frigate can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
originalText: Steam Frigate can't attack unless the defending player has an island in play.
flavor:
"Is it merchants or is it pirates?"
"It's Talas—there's no difference."

name: Stone Rain
text: Destroy target land.
originalText: Destroy any one land.
flavor: There goes the neighborhood!

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Swamp
originalText: B

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Swamp
originalText: B

printings: Duel Decks: Phyrexia vs. the Coalition
Duel Decks: Ajani vs. Nicol Bolas
name: Swamp
originalText: B

name: Swarm of Rats
text: Swarm of Rats's power is equal to the number of Rats you control.
originalText: Swarm of Rats has power equal to the number of Rat cards you have in play. (This includes both tapped and untapped Rat cards.)

name: Sylvan Basilisk
text: Whenever Sylvan Basilisk becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature.
originalText: If Sylvan Basilisk attacks and is blocked, destroy all creatures blocking it. (Destroy the creatures before they deal damage. The Basilisk doesn't damage your opponent.)

name: Sylvan Yeti
text: Sylvan Yeti's power is equal to the number of cards in your hand.
originalText: Sylvan Yeti has power equal to the number of cards you have in your hand.
flavor: The deeper the wood, the greater its strength.

name: Talas Air Ship
text: Flying
originalText: Flying
flavor:
"Their ships pollute our air as they themselves pollute our forest."
—Arathel, elvish queen

name: Talas Explorer
text:
Flying
When Talas Explorer enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.
originalText:
Flying
When Talas Explorer comes into play from your hand, look at your opponent's hand.

name: Talas Merchant
flavor: The trader let loose a laugh that made all around him check their purses.

text: {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
flavor:
From time, knowledge.
From knowledge, power.
originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Talas Researcher to draw a card.
name: Talas Researcher

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

name: Talas Scout
text: Flying
originalText: Flying
flavor:
"Scouting a battle before you fight it is just good business."
—Jefan, Talas ship captain

name: Talas Warrior
text: Talas Warrior can't be blocked.
originalText: Talas Warrior can't be blocked.
flavor: The sea is in their blood. Literally.

text: When Temple Acolyte enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
flavor: Young, yes. Inexperienced, yes. Weak? Don't count on it.
originalText: When Temple Acolyte comes into play from your hand, you gain 3 life.
name: Temple Acolyte

text: {T}: You gain 1 life. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
flavor:
"Give us breath. Give us life. Prepare us for the day we make."
—The Alaborn "Rite of Battle"
originalText: On your turn, before you attack, you may tap Temple Elder to gain 1 life.
name: Temple Elder

rulings.text: If a turn has multiple combat phases, the ability can only be activated before the beginning of the declare attackers step of the first combat phase in that turn.

name: Temporal Manipulation

rulings.text: If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

text: Take an extra turn after this one.
originalText: You take another turn after this one.
flavor: Doing something at the last minute isn't so bad when you can make that minute last.

name: Theft of Dreams
text: Draw a card for each tapped creature target opponent controls.
originalText: For each tapped creature your opponent has in play, you draw a card.
flavor: "First they fight, then they sleep, then they dream. And finally I receive my reward."

name: Tidal Surge
text: Tap up to three target creatures without flying.
originalText: Tap any one, two, or three creatures without flying. (Tapped creatures can't block.)
flavor: Four little goblins, trapped by the sea. One teased a serpent, and then there were three.

name: Time Ebb
text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
originalText: Return any one creature from play to the top of its owner's library.
flavor:
"The ogre had come from out of the blue, so that's where I sent it back."
—Talas wizard

name: Touch of Brilliance
text: Draw two cards.
originalText: Draw two cards.
flavor: "I don't want what I don't have. I want more of what I do have."

name: Town Sentry
text: Whenever Town Sentry blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
originalText: If Town Sentry blocks, it gets +0/+2 until the end of the turn.
flavor:
"So he gots a sword. Big deal."
"Yeah, it's a big deal—it's a big sword!"
—Two goblins outside the gates of Trokin

text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor:
"They serve the world best on a platter with shallots and onions."
—Talas sailor
originalText: Tree Monkey can block creatures with flying.
name: Tree Monkey
Tremor
text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
originalText: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying. (This includes your creatures without flying.)
flavor: One little goblin shook up the ground. When the dust cleared, no one was found.

name: Trokin High Guard
flavor: Battle tempers soldiers as fire tempers steel.

name: Undo

rulings.text: The two creatures may have different owners and return to their respective owner's hands.

text: Return two target creatures to their owners' hands.
originalText: Return any two creatures from play to their owner's hand. (You can't play Undo unless you can choose two creatures to return.)

name: Untamed Wilds

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Can fetch a snow land.

text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
originalText: Search your library for a plains, island, swamp, mountain, or forest card and put that land into play. Shuffle your library afterwards.

name: Vampiric Spirit
text:
Flying
When Vampiric Spirit enters the battlefield, you lose 4 life.
originalText:
Flying
When Vampiric Spirit comes into play from your hand, you lose 4 life. (The person who plays Vampiric Spirit loses the life.)

name: Vengeance
text: Destroy target tapped creature.
originalText: Destroy any one tapped creature.
flavor: A bullet renders all sizes equal.

name: Volcanic Hammer
text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
originalText: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to any one creature or player.
flavor: Fire finds its form in the heat of the forge.

name: Volunteer Militia
flavor: People fight hardest on their own soil.

name: Warrior's Stand
text:
Cast Warrior's Stand only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
originalText:
Play Warrior's Stand only after you're attacked, before you declare blockers.
All your creatures get +2/+2 until the end of the turn.

text: Flying
flavor: Two little goblins, out in the sun. Down came a griffin, and then there was one.
originalText: Flying
name: Wild Griffin
Wild Ox
text: Swampwalk
originalText: Swampwalk (If defending player has any swamps in play, Wild Ox can't be blocked.)
flavor: It has the run of the swamps, and it knows it.

name: Wildfire
text: Each player sacrifices four lands. Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature.
originalText: You destroy four of your lands and your opponent destroys four of his or her lands. Then Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature. (This includes your creatures.)

name: Wind Sail
text: One or two target creatures gain flying until end of turn.
originalText: Any one or two creatures gain flying until the end of the turn.
flavor: It pays to be at home both on the sea and in the sky.
